long_desc.thetext:
gwenhywfar (all versions of Fedora and EPEL) uses an old bundled ca-certificates (version 1.87).  The attached patch for rawhide fixes this; scratch build:

http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=11475516 (F22)

Note that gwenhywfar does not currently build in F23 and rawhide due to bug 1239551 (gnutls-3.4 API changes).

Created attachment 1083727
Patch for rawhide

Looking further into this package for bug 1239551, there is actually code to handle a system ca-certificates but it is #if 0'd.  So we could instead enable that code and just remove the file without providing a symlink (FWIW).

Created gwenhywfar tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1289264]

Created gwenhywfar tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1289265]
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-5.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-5.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
Package has been fixed in both Fedora and EPEL.  Can this be closed now?

(In reply to Yaakov Selkowitz from comment #9)
> Package has been fixed in both Fedora and EPEL.  Can this be closed now?

Yes.

gwenhywfar (all versions of Fedora and EPEL) uses an old bundled ca-certificates (version 1.87).  The attached patch for rawhide fixes this; scratch build:

http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=11475516 (F22)

Note that gwenhywfar does not currently build in F23 and rawhide due to bug 1239551 (gnutls-3.4 API changes).

Created attachment 1083727
Patch for rawhide

Looking further into this package for bug 1239551, there is actually code to handle a system ca-certificates but it is #if 0'd.  So we could instead enable that code and just remove the file without providing a symlink (FWIW).

Created gwenhywfar tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1289264]

Created gwenhywfar tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1289265]
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-5.fc23 has been pushed to the Fedora 23 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-5.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
Package has been fixed in both Fedora and EPEL.  Can this be closed now?

(In reply to Yaakov Selkowitz from comment #9)
> Package has been fixed in both Fedora and EPEL.  Can this be closed now?

Yes.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora EPEL. While
only one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions
at the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each
other, you may clone this bug as appropriate.
    
[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1272503,1289264

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for CVE-2015-7542

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi update submission link(s) instead:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new?type_=security&bugs=1272503,1289264
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-4ea455db6d
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-0272adfe4b

gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
If you want to test the update, you can install it with
$ su -c 'yum --enablerepo=epel-testing update gwenhywfar'
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-4ea455db6d

gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
If you want to test the update, you can install it with
$ su -c 'yum --enablerepo=epel-testing update gwenhywfar'
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-0272adfe4b
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
gwenhywfar-4.13.1-2.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

notes: This adjusts gwenhywfar to use the system copy of ca-certificates, instead of a bundled copy.
